newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Sept 23.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Sept 23.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.

Chinese President Jiang Zemin, on an inspection of poor regions along the new Beijing-Kowloon railway, said poverty was not just an economic problem but a political one and that the opening of the railroad would stimulate growth in those areas.
An international seminar on the debts of China's state enterprises concluded in Haikou in Hainan province.
The Industrial and Commercial Bank of China can now allow customers in eight cities to make deposits and withdrawals in any of the cities.
China has begun state purchases of cotton for the buying season starting in late September.
China's State Environmental Protection Agency has ordered the closure of 15 kinds of heavy polluting small-scale businesses such as paper-makers, dye factories and leather tanners.
China's Foreign Trade Minister Wu Yi is to visit the United States on September 26 and 27 to discuss bilateral trade issues with U.S. Secretary of Commerce Mickey Kantor.
Chinese Foreign Minster Qian Qichen is expected to sign the Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty in New York on September 24.
